item.title: [PI] ::Giverank PlayerName Number
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:21, topic:481505”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=599740.msg4214402#msg4214402 date=1360020774]

You love to over-complicate commands.

	if (playerCommand.startsWith("giverank")) {
	    String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ", 2);
	    for (Player player : PlayerHandler.players) {
		if (player != null && player.playerName.toLowerCase().equals(args[1])) {
		    player.playerRights = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
		    player.disconnected = true;
		}
	    }
	    c.sendMessage("You gave " + args[1] + " a new rank!");
	}

Yes it supports spaces.

The method [tt]split(String, int)[/tt] handles this nicely. The second parameter (the integer value) is the amount of splits in the String.

I was never taught a good method on writing commands
But I’ll try this out here after I’m off Teamviewer.
[/quote]

Writing anything… :rolleyes:[/quote]

On a more serious note, you’re command doesn’t dc the second player.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::Giverank PlayerName Number
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:13, topic:481505”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=599740.msg4214030#msg4214030 date=1359971932]

It doesn’t work with people who have spaces because you’re using

     String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");

Creates a new value every time a space is entered. Use:

     String[] args = playerCommand.split(",");

and see if it works then.

I actually did that. mostly.
I did ", "
But now the command is:
::giverank, mod sk8r, X

Then it would be

::giverank,mod sk8r,3

It will ignore the spaces and split with “,”.

[/quote]
Mine had the space after the coma. It worked fine because it looked for the coma first, then the space.
Hmm, is there any way make it work without the coma, and still be able to do the command?[/quote]

Probably. You could try checking the length of the String[] and if it’s over 2, it would put [1] and [2] together to form the player’s name. If it’s not, continue as normal.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::Giverank PlayerName Number

It doesn’t work with people who have spaces because you’re using

     String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");

Creates a new value every time a space is entered. Use:

     String[] args = playerCommand.split(",");

and see if it works then.

I actually did that. mostly.
I did ", "
But now the command is:
::giverank, mod sk8r, X
[/quote]

Then it would be

::giverank,mod sk8r,3

It will ignore the spaces and split with “,”.[/quote]
Mine had the space after the coma. It worked fine because it looked for the coma first, then the space.
Hmm, is there any way make it work without the coma, and still be able to do the command?

item.title: [PI] ::Giverank PlayerName Number
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:481505”]Sorry I’m bad at the filewriter
This?

try (BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(new File("./data/location/", name + ".txt")))) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Server.playerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } writer.write(c.playerName +" Kicked " + playerToBan + "\n"); } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
I didn’t change the location or stuff at the top.
Shouldn’t it be c.playerName?[/quote]

wrote in reply box, so yes.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("kick")) { try (BufferedWriter kick = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(new File("./data/location/", c.playerName + ".txt")))) { for (Player player : PlayerHandler.players) { if (player != null && player.playerName.toLowerCase().equals(playerCommand.substring(5))) { player.teleportToX = 3102; player.teleportToY = 9516; player.disconnected = true; } kick.write(c.playerName + " kicked: " + player.playerName + "\n"); } } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }

just rewrote your command instead.

item.title: [PI] ::Giverank PlayerName Number
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I find re-using a topic is the best way to go
Revision: 317
Base: PI
Current issue: Don’t know how to make this command.
Description:
Basically, I don’t like having all these commands for my server. Call me crazy, but there’s 13 ranks not counting owner, hidden owner and player. That’s a lot of commands to give rank. So I got a witty idea. Make it so the owner would do a command called give rank. This command would be split into 3. First, the command of course, second, the username of whom is getting the rank, third, the int of the rank.
Example:
::giverank test 9
That’d give the account ‘test’ playerRights 9.
I don’t have a clue on how to go about doing this. can someone please help.

Attempt 1:

		if(playerCommand.startsWith("giverank")) {
			try {
				String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
				String otherplayer = args[1];
				int rank = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
				Client c2 = null;
				for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
					if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
						if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(otherplayer)) {
							c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
							break;
						}
					}
				}
				if (c2 == null) {
					c.sendMessage("Player doesn't exist.");
					return;
				}
				c.sendMessage("You gave "+otherplayer+" a new rank!");
				c2.playerRights = rank;
				c2.sendMessage("You've been promoted! Rank auto-assigned after disconnection...");
				c2.disconnected = true;
			} catch(Exception e) {
				c.sendMessage("Use as ::giverank playername rankid");
			} 
		}

It doesn’t work with players that have names with spaces as far as I know. I have to dual log to test normal functionality.
Confirmed working on accounts with No spaces in names.

If I do the command, but with the username “mod sk8r” as the account getting a rank. It doesn’t work.

Read full topic
